intro: Mniodes subspicata, commonly known as the spicate mniodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in meadows or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its distinctive scent. Mniodes subspicata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
